text: one of the attributes of social
intelligence how we deal with each other
uh was described years ago in a book by
a philosopher named Martin bber called I
and thou he talks about two modes of
relating one is an IIT mode where
basically you treat other people as as
an object not as a person uh and so you
whatever you say it's it's like sending
bullets you know I'm going to tell you
this I'm going to tell you that I'm
going to tell you that and you don't
care how the other person takes it how
they're responding the contrast to that
is an IU where you're tuned in you
empathize and how that other person
responds to what you say determines what
you do and say next that's report that's
where you have good chemistry right now
uh the human species generally has an
IIT relationship to Earth and I think
ecological intelligence is about
changing that to an IU relationship to
understanding the impacts that we're
having caring about them and doing
something to improve them
